article.headline: Coronavirus tally: Global cases of COVID-19 top 18 million, 689,625 deaths, Dr. Birx says US in 'dangerous new phase'
article.body: The global tally for confirmed cases of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 climbed above 18 million on Monday, according to data aggregated by Johns Hopkins University, and the death toll rose to 689,625. At least 10.7 million people have recovered. The U.S. case tally climbed to 4.67 million and the death toll rose to 154,860. More than 1.9 million new U.S. cases were reported in July, the most counted in a single month since the start of the outbreak, the Washington Post reported. Dr. Deborah Birx, the coordinator of the White House's coronavirus task force, warned Sunday that the COVID-19 pandemic has entered a “new phase,” while House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she has no confidence in Birx. Brazil is second to the U.S. with 2.7 million cases and 94,104 deaths. India is third measured by cases at 1.8 million, followed by Russia with 854,641 and South Africa with 511,485. The U.K. has 306,319 cases and 46,286 fatalities, the highest in Europe and fourth highest in the world, after Mexico moved past it by deaths on Saturday, Mexico has 439,046 cases and 47,746 deaths. China, where the illness was first reported late last year, has 87,985 cases, and 4,669 fatalities.|
